lines.text: You know you don't have to act with me, Steve. You don't have to say anything, and you don't have to do anything. Not a thing. Oh, maybe just whistle. You know how to whistle, don't you, Steve? You just put your lips together and... blow.
Who was the girl, Steve?
Who was what girl?
The one who left you with such a high opinion of women.
[Slim kisses Steve]
What did you do that for?
I've been wondering if I'd like it.
What's the decision?
I don't know yet.
[They kiss again]
It's even better when you help.
You know Steve, you're not very hard to figure, only at times. Sometimes I know exactly what you're going to say. Most of the time. The other times... the other times, you're just a stinker.

[Oft repeated line]
Was you ever bit by a dead bee?
Drinking don't bother my memory. If it did I wouldn't drink. I couldn't. You see, I'd forget how good it was, then where'd I be? Start drinkin' water, again.
What are you trying to do, guess her weight?
She's heftier that you think.
[lays down fainted woman he has been carrying]
Better loosen her clothes.
You've been doing all right.
[stops him from loosening clothes]
Maybe you'd better look after her husband.
He's not going to run out on me.
Neither is she.
I'm hard to get, Steve. All you have to do is ask me.
You know what you're getting into. It's gonna be rough.

[Referring to Eddie]
I don't see why you keep that man around!
Eddie was a good man before he became a rummy.
I've been figuring, them guys don't think that I'm wise, but they was trying to get me drunk.
[laughs]
They don't know me, do they, Harry?
[Hiccups]
Give her my love.
I'd give her my own if she had that on!
By the way, what are your sympathies?
Minding my own business.
[first lines]
Martinique, in the summer of 1940, shortly after the fall of France.
Forte de France
Morning.
Good Morning, Captain Morgan. What can I do for you today?
Same thing as yesterday.
You and your client wish to make a temporary exit from the port?
*That* is right.
Name?
Ha - Harry Morgan.
Nationality?
Eskimo.
What?
American.
[last lines]
Cricket. I came to say good-bye.
What?
We're leaving now. Thanks for everything.
Hey Slim, are you still happy?
What do you think?
You're both going to take a beating 'til one of you uses that phone. That means one of you will take a beating for nothing.
Anybody got a match?
Change your mind?
No money, those guys cleaned me out.
I forgot too - maybe I can do something, its been a long day and I'm thirsty.
[surveys club patrons]
Picked him out yet?
You don't mind do you?
You're thirsty, go ahead. If I get tired of waiting, I'll be back at that hotel.
All right
[starts moving through tables]

[to a Vichy cop who has just slapped Slim]
Go ahead, slap me...

[to the Bursacs]
Get down on the deck flat and stay there!

[Apprehensively]
But I don't know what good it'll be to try to resist. We will be killed!

[Angrily]
Shut up, both of you! Get down on that deck flat! You save France - I want to save my boat!

[Steering the boat]
What's the matter? Why are you lookin' at me like that fer? What are you laughin' at?
Just a joke that neither one of us knows the answer to.
What joke?
Whether you're gonna hold together or not.

[His feelings hurt]
Don't say that, Harry! I'm a good man! You know I am!
Yeah, I know you are, but you're goin' all over the ocean. Stay on your course.
Why do you always... Hey, could I have just one? I don't want to get the shakes.
Make it short! I want you rum brave, not useless.

[Anxious to get below decks to have his drink]
Thanks, Harry!
What sort of a day will it be?
I don't know. Just about like yesterday. Only better.
